Hey guys, so I work at Secondary School in England, and I was wondering if you were planning any bulk licensing for Education at any point in the future? I know that the game itself isn't Educational, but it certainly gives students the basic ideas of forces and gravity, and it would make a good lesson introduction and/or reward task.

Anyway, I am sure that other people in education would feel the same, but most school will only buy software that has bulk licenses.

If not, I assume that there wouldn't be a problem with using one install on a computer/projector to a class of students?

I would contact Squad directly from one of the emails listed on the main Contact page.

You're more likely to get a better response than here on the forums.

As far as buying a single copy and projecting the screen, I don't think there's any problems with that. It's still one copy on one CPU which is what the license allows.

Cheers!

Capt'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager

Okay so I just had a look at the FAQ on the website...

It says:

I WANT TO USE KSP FOR A SCHOOL PROJECT, MUSEUM, OR ANOTHER EDUCATIONAL RELATED AFFAIR, MAY I?

Yes, the KSP Team encourages "Space Education", letting us know about it and giving us credit would be greatly appreciated, though. If your project would require you to buy a whole lot of licenses, please Contact us to discuss it.

So I guess I will get in contact! Good to know!
Oh, man... I wish I was a student at that school. Lucky kids.
If you're looking to teach students about gravity, I'd definitely recommend this fun little flash game http://www.nowykurier.com/toys/gravity/gravity.html

In this year Hong Kong public exam , one of the question is about orbital operations.

If I have never play KSP ,I think I am not able to answer that question...
